alert.note: Alert for Bath (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 8:30PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of east central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in east central Kentucky, Bath, Estill, Fleming, Menifee, Montgomery, Powell and Rowan. In southeast Kentucky, Lee, Owsley and Wolfe. * WHEN...Until 1015 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 829 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated that the heaviest rains had moved east; however, runoff from previous heavy rainfall will continue to cause minor flooding of low lying areas. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mount Sterling, Morehead, Stanton, Irvine, Flemingsburg, Owingsville, Frenchburg, Marshall, Jeffersonville, Camargo, Clay City, Ravenna, Sharpsburg, Salt Lick, Campsites in the Indian Creek area of the Daniel Boone National Forrest, Fairview, Hope, Walkers Crossing, Clay Lick and Peeled Oak.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
